ratings.comment: His lectures are him taking notes out of the textbook, he will use exactly the same examples as the textbook. I found the textbook a good resource for the class though. He will ask for questions, wait two seconds, and then move on. Going to office hours is helpful for the homework. Practice exams were much easier than the exams.

Actually nice professor, he uses comments on piazza to calculate the extra credit. Make sure you have full points cuz I was only 1 pt below AB and that was how extra credit came into handy. However, his exams are extremely hard. But he also sets a generous curve.

Math 340 is not hard, but the idea of linear algebra is new to most people, which makes this course daunting. Prof Kwon has a stern face and doesn't smile, but he readily answers questions no matter how stupid they are. A little downside is that his introduction to something new can be confusing, but as he lay out the details, you'll be fine.

Very kind and helpful in lecture and on Piazza. Never makes you feel dumb for asking a question. Explains some concepts more clearly than others but with some supplemental textbook reading I didnt have much trouble feeling like I understood everything; sometimes, I would be confused after one lecture but after the next one it all fell into place.

Dohyun is really nice. I like asking questions no matter after lecture or through Piazza, he always gave feedback for our questions. He also made improvements about the lecture throughout the semester. I can feel that he made his best to improve the atmosphere and interaction during lecture. I'm sure that he'll do better in future lectures.

Very generous with grades and a nice guy. Takes feedback very seriously and does clear steps to improve, quickly. I didn't really learn from lectures but the midterms were so ridiculously close to the homework, they were straightforward. I wish I could take another one of his classes :)

While his lectures by themselves aren't the clearest, if you do as he recommends by supplementing them with the textbook and other resources, the subject becomes clearer. I also love how active he is on Piazza by answering questions no matter how "dumb" they are. His office hours are also phenomenal. Great dude who I think can become a great prof.

I give Dohyun credit, Math340 has always been a difficult class with difficult concepts to grasp; yet, he follows the department's lead and takes his lecture notes directly from the book, doesn't add anything new. You need to know everything for the exams, I suggest reviewing homework assignments. Nice guy, has time to grow into a great prof.

Dohyun is new, and you can tell by his quiet demeanor. However, he explains concepts well and makes sure the point gets across. Lectures can be a little dry sometimes, but I can see the effort he puts. He constantly asks for feedback and takes suggestions seriously. Great during office hours, possibly better than in lecture.

Prof Kwon is really accessible after class. He always replies emails or questions posted on piazza really quick ( roughly in one day). One thing I really appreciate is that he always endorse the questions students post on the piazza no matter how stupid they are. His lecture is clear and well organized. However, his exams are extremely difficult.
